Returns: an array of Cookies parsed from the Set-Cookie value
Parameters: the Set-Cookie received from the server
Throws: if an exception occurs during parsing
parse(org.apache.http.Header, org.apache.Description: Parses the Set-Cookie value into an array of Syntax of the Set-Cookie HTTP Response Header: This is the format a CGI script would use to add to the HTTP headers a new piece of data which is to be stored by the client for later retrieval. Please note that Netscape draft specification does not fully conform to the HTTP header format. Netscape draft does not specify whether multiple cookies may be sent in one header. Hence, comma character may be present in unquoted cookie value or unquoted parameter value.
parse(org.apache.http.Header, org.apache.FullName: public List<Cookie> parse (Header header, CookieOrigin origin)

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit Netscape cookie draft compliant cookie policy
